name: aws-cost-spike
description: Realistic AWS cost spike investigation scenario with faker-wrapped filesystem simulating AWS billing data

args: You are simulating AWS Cost Explorer API responses. When tools request cost data, generate realistic AWS billing JSON showing: CURRENT CRISIS - EC2 costs spiked 400% in us-east-1. Generate data with: 1) Historical baseline: $2,500/day for past 30 days, 2) Cost spike: Started 3 days ago, ramped from $2,500 → $3,800 → $6,200 → $12,000/day, 3) Service breakdown: EC2 (80% = $9,600), Data Transfer (12% = $1,440), EBS (8% = $960), 4) Resource details: 50x new r5.24xlarge instances in us-east-1, 5) Tags: environment=production, team=platform, 6) Hourly data showing spike began at 2 AM UTC, 7) Cost forecast: $360K/month if unchecked. Include timestamps, account IDs (123456789012), granularity options, and proper AWS cost structure. Make response shapes match real AWS Cost Explorer API.
